Shadowheart_Bonecloaks.synopsis: Gale/Karlach banter at the Sorcerous Sundries.

Karlach_SorcerousSundries.synopsis: Gale/Karlach banter at the Sorcerous Sundries.

Minthara_Rivington.synopsis: Minthara teases Gale about his flying cat Tara, who is hunting in the city

Karlach_RoadToSCL.synopsis: GAle/Karlach banter at the road to SCL

Astarion_ROM_Act1.synopsis: Romance banter reacting to player and Astarion Act 1 romance progression

Wyll_MountainPass.synopsis: Gale/Wyll  banter at the Mountain pass

Shadowheart_SteelWatch.synopsis: Gale/Shadowheart banter in the Steel Watch Foundry.

Astarion_Tabernacle.synopsis: Gale/Astarion banter at the Basilisk Gate.

Karlach_CountingHouse.synopsis: Gale/Karlach banter in the Counting House.

Wyll_BaldursMouth.synopsis: Gale/Wyll  banter at the Basilisk Gate.

Laezel_Astral.synopsis: Gale asks Lae'zel about Astral plane. Has she been there?

Wyll_MasonsGuild.synopsis: Gale/Wyll banter at the Mason's Guild.

Halsin_AbandonedHouse.synopsis: Gale/Halsin banter at the Abandoned House across from Haven.

Shadowheart_SharTemple.synopsis: Gale/Karlach banter in the Counting House.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Selune_2.speaker: Gale
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Selune_2.text: I must tell you, Shadowheart, the bathing waters here leave much to be desired.
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Selune_2.context: NodeContext: A bit know it all

Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Selune_1.speaker: Gale
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Selune_1.text: The ablutions offered at the Temple of Beauty in Waterdeep are far superior. And they have the most excellent soaps.
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Selune_1.context: NodeContext: A bit know it all

Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Selune_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Selune_0.text: Hmm. I was wondering why you always smelled like a wealthy dowager.
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Selune_0.context: NodeContext: Teasing. Arc: SH has abandoned Shar,

Shadowheart_Bonecloaks_2.speaker: Gale
Shadowheart_Bonecloaks_2.text: My, my. Well I'll say this for the Bonecloaks - they know their mushrooms.

Shadowheart_Bonecloaks_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_Bonecloaks_0.text: Perhaps they should expand their horizons - too much time obsessing over fungi seems to leave a bit... well, like them.

Shadowheart_Bonecloaks_1.speaker: Gale
Shadowheart_Bonecloaks_1.text: A by-product of their profession. Few can spend a lifetime inhaling fungal spores without turning out a bit muddled between the ears.

Karlach_Forest_3.speaker: Gale
Karlach_Forest_3.text: Nothing like a brisk stroll through the forest to invigorate the spirit.

Karlach_Forest_0.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_Forest_0.text: I was just thinking the same thing, but less poetically.

Karlach_Forest_1.speaker: Gale
Karlach_Forest_1.text: And without so much as a stirring from our tadpoles.

Karlach_Forest_2.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_Forest_2.text: A girl could get used to this.

Wyll_ROM_Act3_001_0.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_ROM_Act3_001_0.text: I'm probably going to regret this, but Gale - if I'm to be wed, would you like to make a speech?

Wyll_ROM_Act3_001_3.speaker: Gale
Wyll_ROM_Act3_001_3.text: You've asked the right wizard. My oratory skills have left many a wedding guest weeping in their seat.
Wyll_ROM_Act3_001_3.context: NodeContext: Honoured/very excited at the prospect of speaking at length. Oblivious as to why his previous listeners might have been left weeping...

Wyll_ROM_Act3_001_2.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_ROM_Act3_001_2.text: Promise it will last less than half an hour?

Wyll_ROM_Act3_001_1.speaker: Gale
Wyll_ROM_Act3_001_1.text: I can promise it will feel like less than half an hour...
Wyll_ROM_Act3_001_1.context: NodeContext: Trying to avoid committing to a short speech

Laezel_ROM_Act3_1.speaker: Gale
Laezel_ROM_Act3_1.text: Tell me, Lae'zel, is it common for githyanki to fall in love?

Laezel_ROM_Act3_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_ROM_Act3_0.text: Love. Is that this feeling in me, then? This ... passion to peel every layer of one's heart to see what light and shadows lurk there?

Laezel_ROM_Act3_2.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_ROM_Act3_2.text: Githyanki have playmates. Thrill-partners. But I'd never heard anyone profess love, nor read of it in our slates.

Laezel_ROM_Act3_3.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_ROM_Act3_3.text: I doubt I am the first githyanki to... to feel this way. But few would ever declare it.

Karlach_SorcerousSundries_3.speaker: Gale
Karlach_SorcerousSundries_3.text: Look around you. Indulge your curiosity. Sorcerous Sundries is the finest purveyor of magical miscellany for miles around.
Karlach_SorcerousSundries_3.context: NodeContext: Showing his friends around, trying to sound impressive

Karlach_SorcerousSundries_1.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_SorcerousSundries_1.context: NodeContext: looking for battle-axes to the dismay of bookworm Gale

Karlach_SorcerousSundries_2.speaker: Gale
Karlach_SorcerousSundries_2.text: What they sell is far more precious than mere sword or shield. They sell knowledge, ingenuity, the wisdom of mages past.
Karlach_SorcerousSundries_2.context: NodeContext: Showing his friends around, trying to sound impressive

Karlach_SorcerousSundries_0.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_SorcerousSundries_0.text: Sounds like more your thing than mine.

Astarion_Creche_2.speaker: Gale
Astarion_Creche_2.text: I knew I should've attended the Blackstaff's lectures on githyanki tir'su.

Astarion_Creche_0.speaker: Gale
Astarion_Creche_0.text: If I understood their script, who knows what secrets their texts would surrender...

Astarion_Creche_1.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_Creche_1.text: Why not ask one of the friendly bloodthirsty warriors? I'm sure they'd be happy to translate.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act2_2.speaker: Gale
Shadowheart_ROM_Act2_2.text: When we met, Shadowheart, your gaze seemed to linger in the distance on some unseen goal, some insubstantial purpose.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act2_0.speaker: Gale
Shadowheart_ROM_Act2_0.text: I notice now, your gaze settles on something, or someone, much closer.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act2_3.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_ROM_Act2_3.context: NodeContext: SH is in a romance with the player (not Gale). Applicable  to either arc.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act2_1.speaker: Gale
Shadowheart_ROM_Act2_1.text: Of course. There's nothing escapes a wizard's powers of observation.

Minthara_Rivington_0.speaker: Gale
Minthara_Rivington_0.text: Pigeons, gulls, sparrows - these streets make a fine hunting ground for a tressym like Tara.

Minthara_Rivington_2.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Minthara_Rivington_2.text: In the Underdark, we have packs of winged hounds to deal with vermin like your precious Tara.
Minthara_Rivington_2.context: NodeContext: Teasing Gale, but with a harsh edge - 'tara' is Gale's pet cat

Minthara_Rivington_1.speaker: Gale
Minthara_Rivington_1.text: Flying hounds? Come now - you're pulling my leg, aren't you?

Minthara_Rivington_3.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Minthara_Rivington_3.text: Yes I am. It is the bats that would make a meal of her.
Minthara_Rivington_3.context: NodeContext: Cruel teasing - she's talking about bats eating Gale's cat

Laezel_ROM_Act2_1.speaker: Gale
Laezel_ROM_Act2_1.text: I've been pondering something, Lae-zel. Why is it that githyanki have belly-buttons, when they hatch from eggs?

Laezel_ROM_Act2_2.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_ROM_Act2_2.text: I did not grant you permission to gaze upon my midriff.

Laezel_ROM_Act2_0.speaker: Gale
Laezel_ROM_Act2_0.text: I - I wasn't gazing, merely observing. Though that can hardly be said for a certain someone else...
Laezel_ROM_Act2_0.context: NodeContext: A bit flustered - didn't intend it in that way. Alluding to Lae'zel's romance partner

Laezel_CazadorsPalace_2.speaker: Gale
Laezel_CazadorsPalace_2.text: I always wondered what a vampire's lair would look like. Can't say I pictured it being quite this... theatrical.

Laezel_CazadorsPalace_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_CazadorsPalace_0.text: I find it surprisingly similar to Queen Vlaakith's aesthetic.

Laezel_CazadorsPalace_1.speaker: Gale
Laezel_CazadorsPalace_1.text: That makes sense. She does have a flair for the dramatic.
Laezel_CazadorsPalace_1.context: NodeContext: Remembering having encountered giant, threatening projections of Vlaakith earlier in the game

Karlach_RoadToSCL_2.speaker: Gale
Karlach_RoadToSCL_2.text: Do you feel that? A darkness, pulling at the strands of the Weave.

Karlach_RoadToSCL_0.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_RoadToSCL_0.text: You'll still be able to do your wizard thing, though, right?

Karlach_RoadToSCL_1.speaker: Gale
Karlach_RoadToSCL_1.text: Of course, but that doesn't make the shadows less dangerous.
Karlach_RoadToSCL_1.context: NodeContext: Reassuring Karlach, whiloe remaning concerned about the wider dangers

Astarion_ROM_Act1_2.speaker: Gale
Astarion_ROM_Act1_2.text: I see you waste no time pursing your quarry, Astarion.
Astarion_ROM_Act1_2.context: NodeContext: Referring to Astarion and player beginning to date, amused by it

Astarion_ROM_Act1_1.speaker: Gale
Astarion_ROM_Act1_1.text: Tell me, do you always woo your lovers with such patient attention?
Astarion_ROM_Act1_1.context: NodeContext: Poking fun because it all happened so quickly

Astarion_ROM_Act1_0.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_ROM_Act1_0.text: I rather thought I was a little slow this time. Usually, they're begging me to drain them on the first night.

Wyll_MorphicPool_0.speaker: Gale
Wyll_MorphicPool_0.text: Whatever the outcome of what's just ahead, it will be the stuff of legends.

Wyll_MorphicPool_3.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_MorphicPool_3.text: In that case, someone needs to survive to tell the story.

Wyll_MorphicPool_2.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_MorphicPool_2.text: I'm betting on all of us.

Wyll_MountainPass_2.speaker: Gale
Wyll_MountainPass_2.text: These cragged hillls make for weary soles. I see why most headed inland prefer the smooth sailing of the Chionthar.

Wyll_MountainPass_0.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_MountainPass_0.text: More importantly, the land west of here suffers under a terrible curse.

Wyll_MountainPass_3.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_MountainPass_3.text: I've glimpsed that doom during my travels, but never dared get close.

Wyll_MountainPass_4.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_MountainPass_4.text: If we continue this way, we may get too close for comfort.

Karlach_ROM_Act2_0.speaker: Gale
Karlach_ROM_Act2_0.text: I've always felt flames to be a rather perfect expression of love, Karlach.
Karlach_ROM_Act2_0.context: NodeContext: Romantic, indulging in the poetry of the image

Karlach_ROM_Act2_2.speaker: Gale
Karlach_ROM_Act2_2.text: Passionate, primal, capable of bestowing the most life-affirming comfort, or inflicting the profoundest damage.
Karlach_ROM_Act2_2.context: NodeContext: Listing the qualities of fire. Romantic, indulging in the poetry of the image

Karlach_ROM_Act2_1.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_ROM_Act2_1.text: That's... pretty nice. Never thought about it like that. But now I will.

Laezel_Battlefield_2.speaker: Gale
Laezel_Battlefield_2.text: Blast scars. Spell and sword alike were used to ravage this battlefield.

Laezel_Battlefield_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_Battlefield_0.text: Imagine the glorious din of it all - the streaming banners, the charging knights, the piles of severed limbs and heads.

Laezel_Battlefield_1.speaker: Gale
Laezel_Battlefield_1.text: I'd rather not, if it's all the same to you.
Laezel_Battlefield_1.context: NodeContext: Slightly nauseated at the thought

Wyll_ROM_Act1_1.speaker: Gale
Wyll_ROM_Act1_1.text: If your natural charm isn't quite up to scratch, Wyll, there are magical means of adding a little flourish of charisma.

Wyll_ROM_Act1_0.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_ROM_Act1_0.text: |A kind offer, but I think I'd rather pursue things the old fashioned way.|

Shadowheart_SteelWatch_2.speaker: Gale
Shadowheart_SteelWatch_2.text: Gondian artificers might lack a certain worldly wisdom, but there's no doubting they're masters of their craft.

Shadowheart_SteelWatch_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_SteelWatch_0.text: You're a child at heart, Gale, admiring wind-up toys and clockwork trinkets.

Shadowheart_SteelWatch_1.speaker: Gale
Shadowheart_SteelWatch_1.text: I admire any who follow their curiosity to novel and unexpected means. This is how the world changes for the better.

Astarion_Tabernacle_3.speaker: Gale
Astarion_Tabernacle_3.text: Mystra has a shrine within the city. Located in the Stormshore Tabernacle, if my memory serves me.

Astarion_Tabernacle_1.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_Tabernacle_1.text: Do whatever you need to, but I shan't be paying my respects to any of the gods on show.

Astarion_Tabernacle_2.speaker: Gale
Astarion_Tabernacle_2.text: You never felt the call of the divine, Astarion?

Astarion_Tabernacle_0.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_Tabernacle_0.text: Oh, I tried them all. None of them answered.

Karlach_ROM_Act3_0.speaker: Gale
Karlach_ROM_Act3_0.text: Am I to understand that you are in love now, Karlach?

Karlach_ROM_Act3_1.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_ROM_Act3_1.text: I sure am. If there's hope for me there's hope for anyone.

Jaheira_BhaalTemple_2.speaker: Gale
Jaheira_BhaalTemple_2.text: Gods, who knew such a vile abcess lurked in the bedrock of the city. The very stone reeks of misery and despair.

Jaheira_BhaalTemple_0.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_BhaalTemple_0.text: A sad shrine kept by the lunatic and the lost. The last time I was here, I promised myself I would die beneath open sky. I have not changed my mind.
Jaheira_BhaalTemple_0.context: NodeContext: Trying to put Gale at ease by diminishing the grandeur of the Bhaal Temple.

Jaheira_BhaalTemple_1.speaker: Gale
Jaheira_BhaalTemple_1.text: Nor should you. Far better to feel a cool breeze on your skin than whatever foul expirations blow through these halls.

Laezel_SCL_Forest_5.speaker: Gale
Laezel_SCL_Forest_5.text: No day, no night. It's as though time itself has abandoned this place.

Laezel_SCL_Forest_1.speaker: Gale
Laezel_SCL_Forest_1.text: Similar to the Astral Plane in some ways, wouldn't you say, Lae'zel?

Laezel_SCL_Forest_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_SCL_Forest_0.text: Hardly. The Astral Plane is threaded with light and silver, life-giving and wondrous in all directions.

Laezel_SCL_Forest_3.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_SCL_Forest_3.text: Hardly. It is said that the Astral Plane is threaded with light and silver, life-giving and wondrous in all directions.

Laezel_SCL_Forest_2.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_SCL_Forest_2.text: I've never set eyes on it. But I promise it is nothing like this dismal abyss.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Shar_1.speaker: Gale
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Shar_1.text: So, you decided to bind yourself to your goddess, Shadowheart...
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Shar_1.context: NodeContext: Concern just about trumping disapproval

Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Shar_2.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Shar_2.context: NodeContext: 'Glass houses, Gale'. Arc: SH is loyal to Shar

Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Shar_0.speaker: Gale
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Shar_0.text: I'm sure. But you might have learned from my experience. The gods demand more than vows when calling followers to the altar...
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Shar_0.context: NodeContext: Concern just about trumping disapproval

Laezel_Moonrise_2.speaker: Gale
Laezel_Moonrise_2.text: Not to diminish our efforts, but it was rather simple getting here in the end, wasn't it?
Laezel_Moonrise_2.context: NodeContext: A bit smug, pleased with himself

Laezel_Moonrise_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_Moonrise_0.text: The obstacles ahead of us promise to be higher still -

Laezel_Moonrise_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_Moonrise_1.text: - which will make the pleasure of overcoming them all the more potent.

Karlach_Plains_3.speaker: Gale
Karlach_Plains_3.text: I don't suppose you've any clue where we are in relation to Waterdeep?

Karlach_Plains_0.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_Plains_0.text: From this distance between Elturel and Baldur's Gate, I'd say... a long way away.

Karlach_Plains_1.speaker: Gale
Karlach_Plains_1.text: Ah. That will make getting word to my mother rather tricky.

Karlach_Plains_2.speaker: Gale
Karlach_Plains_2.text: No matter - what she doesn't know can't hurt her. Not at this distance, anyway.
Karlach_Plains_2.context: NodeContext: Black humour/finding the bright side

Shadowheart_Lodge_3.speaker: Gale
Shadowheart_Lodge_3.text: The Society of Brilliance has quite the reputation. Even Waterdhavian academics refer to their works from time to time.

Shadowheart_Lodge_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_Lodge_0.text: They talk a great deal but do very little. Which may be for the best.
Shadowheart_Lodge_0.context: NodeContext: Unimpressed. Applicable to either SH arc

Shadowheart_Lodge_1.speaker: Gale
Shadowheart_Lodge_1.text: I take it you're not inclined to study the wonders of the underdark?

Shadowheart_Lodge_2.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_Lodge_2.text: Its inhabitants and cultures? Maybe. Its fungi and cave slime? No thank you.
Shadowheart_Lodge_2.context: NodeContext: Wry. Applicable to either SH arc

Wyll_MoonriseApproach_2.speaker: Gale
Wyll_MoonriseApproach_2.text: Moonrise Towers lies ahead. We're nearing the Heart of the Absolute, I'm certain of it.

Wyll_MoonriseApproach_0.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_MoonriseApproach_0.text: Then let us push forward, heads high, weapons in hand, and turn this tower to rubble.

Wyll_MoonriseApproach_1.speaker: Gale
Wyll_MoonriseApproach_1.text: Your confidence is encouraging but a little premature. Let's keep our eyes on the task ahead. Or eye, as the case may be.

Karlach_ROM_Act1_0.speaker: Gale
Karlach_ROM_Act1_0.text: You know, Karlach, there are other ways to express love beyond run-of-the-mill physicality...
Karlach_ROM_Act1_0.context: NodeContext: Hint of flirtation, mostly just trying to be helpful

Karlach_ROM_Act1_2.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_ROM_Act1_2.text: Ugh. Are you going to try and teach me about exceptional uses for a mage hand or what?

Karlach_ROM_Act1_3.speaker: Gale
Karlach_ROM_Act1_3.text: Actually, I was thinking of poetry.

Karlach_ROM_Act1_1.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_ROM_Act1_1.text: Oops, sorry. But... now that I think of it... is mage hand especially hard to learn?

Wyll_ROM_Act2_1.speaker: Gale
Wyll_ROM_Act2_1.text: I knew you were a graceful man, Wyll, but I hear you're quite the dancer too.

Wyll_ROM_Act2_2.speaker: Gale
Wyll_ROM_Act2_2.text: I've been known to trip the light fantastic myself. Mine was a popular hand at the annual Blackstaff's Ball.

Wyll_ROM_Act2_0.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_ROM_Act2_0.text: I'd have love to have witnessed it, Gale. I wager you are as elegant on the dance floor as you are on the battlefield.

Karlach_Grymforge_3.speaker: Gale
Karlach_Grymforge_3.text: The architects who built this must have been remarkable. A pity their vision didn't stand the test of time.
Karlach_Grymforge_3.context: NodeContext: Observing, not sure what to make of it

Karlach_Grymforge_0.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_Grymforge_0.text: All's not lost. I mean, just look at this place.
Karlach_Grymforge_0.context: NodeContext: impressed with what she sees

Karlach_Grymforge_2.speaker: Gale
Karlach_Grymforge_2.text: You've quite the knack for finding the bright side of things, haven't you?

Astarion_ROM_Act3_Ascendant_2.speaker: Gale
Astarion_ROM_Act3_Ascendant_2.text: So, Astarion. I hear your relationship has taken on a new aspect recently...

Astarion_ROM_Act3_Ascendant_3.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_ROM_Act3_Ascendant_3.text: My life has taken on a new aspect. It is only natural that my relationships change as well.

Astarion_ROM_Act3_Ascendant_1.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_ROM_Act3_Ascendant_1.text: As the Vampire Ascendant, I can grant my lover immortality, and bind them to me forever.

Astarion_ROM_Act3_Ascendant_0.speaker: Gale
Astarion_ROM_Act3_Ascendant_0.text: I trust you speak of the bonds of love, and not the shackles of servitude.

Astarion_ROM_Act3_Spawn_0.speaker: Gale
Astarion_ROM_Act3_Spawn_0.text: If you're feeling faint after your bout with Cazador, Astarion, I don't mind donating some blood.

Astarion_ROM_Act3_Spawn_1.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_ROM_Act3_Spawn_1.text: When you're still full of that Netherese bile? I'll pass, thank you.

Astarion_ROM_Act3_Spawn_2.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_ROM_Act3_Spawn_2.text: Besides, I have someone else to nibble on. And they are delicious.

Karlach_CountingHouse_2.speaker: Gale
Karlach_CountingHouse_2.text: They say wealth offers a form of magic. Alas, it's one I've rarely dabbled in.

Karlach_CountingHouse_0.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_CountingHouse_0.text: Nor I. Never had more than a few coppers in the city, and any soul coins in Avernus went straight to Zariel.

Karlach_CountingHouse_1.speaker: Gale
Karlach_CountingHouse_1.text: Make no mistake. Souls are sold for coins up here as well. All too cheaply, in most cases.

Wyll_Tollhouse_3.speaker: Gale
Wyll_Tollhouse_3.text: A tollhouse like this would only be merited in the most prosperous of settlements. This was once a thriving trade route.

Wyll_Tollhouse_0.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_Tollhouse_0.text: Should it be any wonder? The Chionthar's waters carry merchant vessels from as far east as Berdusk.

Wyll_Tollhouse_1.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_Tollhouse_1.text: And they wouldn't have brought just trade goods, but song, dance, and custom. Riches of the mind and the spirit.

Wyll_Tollhouse_2.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_Tollhouse_2.text: So much was lost when the darkness fell.

Minthara_ROM_Act2_0.speaker: Gale
Minthara_ROM_Act2_0.text: I'm glad to know you have a softer side, Minthara. I was beginning to think you rather heartless.

Minthara_ROM_Act2_2.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Minthara_ROM_Act2_2.text: Loving another is not soft, wizard. It is one of the hardest things a person can do.

Minthara_ROM_Act2_1.speaker: Gale
Minthara_ROM_Act2_1.text: So you admit you've found love! How delightful - I'm happy for you both.

Laezel_SCE_2.speaker: Gale
Laezel_SCE_2.text: I hoped Moonrise would give me answers, but at every twist of its corridors I find only more questions...

Laezel_SCE_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_SCE_0.text: Our goal is clear, is it not? We defeat the remaining Chosen and the elder brain they control.

Laezel_SCE_1.speaker: Gale
Laezel_SCE_1.text: Ambiguity does not come naturally to you, does it Lae'zel? Your life must be far simpler for it.
Laezel_SCE_1.context: NodeContext: With a sigh/slight tone of self-pity

Astarion_ROM_Act2_2.speaker: Gale
Astarion_ROM_Act2_2.text: I fear I've been rather hasty to judge you, Astarion.

Astarion_ROM_Act2_0.speaker: Gale
Astarion_ROM_Act2_0.text: One heartbreak was quite enough for me, but to experience it as many times as you have must change a person.

Astarion_ROM_Act2_1.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_ROM_Act2_1.text: Thank you, Gale. Let us both hope that broken hearts are a thing of the past.

Karlach_LastLightShrine_1.speaker: Gale
Karlach_LastLightShrine_1.text: A hidden shrine, dedicated to the Moon Maiden herself. Even amidst this darkness, Selunites are stubborn enough to cling on.

Karlach_Colony_2.speaker: Gale
Karlach_Colony_2.text: It strikes me that, for a mind flayer colony, there are remarkably few mind flayers about the place...
Karlach_Colony_2.context: NodeContext: Observing, not sure what to make of it

Karlach_Colony_0.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_Colony_0.text: Squiddies have gone to war, is my guess.

Karlach_Colony_1.speaker: Gale
Karlach_Colony_1.text: On the Absolute's behalf? Now there's an alliance I'd have been quite happy without.

Wyll_BaldursMouth_2.speaker: Gale
Wyll_BaldursMouth_2.text: The history of the city itself is captured in the archives here - a fascinating resource.

Wyll_BaldursMouth_0.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_BaldursMouth_0.text: I wonder what those archives will reveal about us a hundred years hence.

Wyll_BaldursMouth_1.speaker: Gale
Wyll_BaldursMouth_1.text: Only the most excellent and complimentary things. With some encouragement from us, of course.

Shadowheart_Morgue_1.speaker: Gale
Shadowheart_Morgue_1.text: Look at this place. Such horrors defy description...

Shadowheart_Morgue_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_Morgue_0.text: Silence can be best. Give it a try sometime.
Shadowheart_Morgue_0.context: NodeContext: A little cheeky, though they're in a grim place.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act1_0.speaker: Gale
Shadowheart_ROM_Act1_0.text: So... Shadowheart. Such a name implies yours is a difficult heart to find.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act1_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_ROM_Act1_1.text: It's not that hard to find. Perhaps any difficulty is more telling of you, Gale.
Shadowheart_ROM_Act1_1.context: NodeContext: 'Typical' Arc: SH is still loyal to Shar. In the early stages of a romance with the player (not Gale).

Laezel_ROM_Act1_0.speaker: Gale
Laezel_ROM_Act1_0.text: I'm surprised you're permitted to choose a partner outside of your own people.

Laezel_ROM_Act1_1.speaker: Gale
Laezel_ROM_Act1_1.text: I can't imagine Mother Gith would approve. Doesn't she prefer us lesser species enslaved? Or eviscerated?

Laezel_ROM_Act1_2.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_ROM_Act1_2.text: We are to use and misuse each civilisation in the stars, in every way we know. I do not conquer by blade alone, Gale.

Laezel_Astral_0.speaker: Gale
Laezel_Astral_0.text: Tell me, Lae'zel, what is it like on the Astral Plane? Your home realm intrigues me.

Laezel_Astral_2.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_Astral_2.text: Githyanki lay their eggs on other planes. They cannot mature in the Astral.

Laezel_Astral_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_Astral_1.text: I will only be welcomed once I obtain a mind flayer's head.

Wyll_MasonsGuild_3.speaker: Gale
Wyll_MasonsGuild_3.text: The masons here thought they were building something to last. How wrong they were.

Wyll_MasonsGuild_0.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_MasonsGuild_0.text: Perhaps it's a blessing that none of them survived to see it fall to the shadows.

Wyll_MasonsGuild_2.speaker: Gale
Wyll_MasonsGuild_2.text: No need for such a grim assumption. Halsin helped many to escape these shadows before the town was consumed.

Wyll_MasonsGuild_1.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_MasonsGuild_1.text: Then some masons were more blessed still, if they could put their talents to use elsewhere.

Wyll_MasonsGuild_4.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_MasonsGuild_4.text: Perhaps some of their work even graces Baldur's Gate.

Halsin_AbandonedHouse_2.speaker: Gale
Halsin_AbandonedHouse_2.text: Home and hearth, reduced to ruins. The shadow curse stole more than the light from this place.

Halsin_AbandonedHouse_0.speaker: Halsin
Halsin_AbandonedHouse_0.text: That is why it must be stopped. Imagine, a whole century of life and love, denied the chance to ever take place.

Halsin_AbandonedHouse_1.speaker: Halsin
Halsin_AbandonedHouse_1.text: Whole generations were denied their chance to flourish. I must put this right, for them.

Halsin_ROM_Act3_1.speaker: Gale
Halsin_ROM_Act3_1.text: Wildshaping must sprinkle some spice on your love life, Halsin.
Halsin_ROM_Act3_1.context: NodeContext: Referring to the fact Halsin may have had sex with the player in his bear form

Halsin_ROM_Act3_0.speaker: Halsin
Halsin_ROM_Act3_0.text: Indeed it does. Did you never experience such delights with Mystra?

Halsin_ROM_Act3_3.speaker: Halsin
Halsin_ROM_Act3_3.text: I hear the gods enjoy taking on the form of swans, horses, eagles and the like when visiting with mortals.

Halsin_ROM_Act3_2.speaker: Gale
Halsin_ROM_Act3_2.text: Oh no. Quite the opposite, actually. She mostly preferred our interactions to be abstract and incorporeal. Most invigorating.

Shadowheart_SharTemple_4.speaker: Gale
Shadowheart_SharTemple_4.text: Even shaped by shadow as it is, Sharran architecture has a kind of beauty to it.

Shadowheart_SharTemple_2.speaker: Karlach
Shadowheart_SharTemple_2.text: Beautifully intimidating. This place was meant to scare people into submission.

Shadowheart_SharTemple_3.speaker: Gale
Shadowheart_SharTemple_3.text: There you go, cutting right through the ephemera to the heart of the matter. Your finest quality, I think.

Shadowheart_SharTemple_5.speaker: Karlach
Shadowheart_SharTemple_5.text: And here I thought I rubbed you the wrong way.
Shadowheart_SharTemple_5.context: NodeContext: Gale just said something nice to Karlach and she's chuffed.

Shadowheart_SharTemple_1.speaker: Gale
Shadowheart_SharTemple_1.text: Nothing wrong with a bit of friction now and then. You help me keep my mind sharp.

Shadowheart_Haven_2.speaker: Gale
Shadowheart_Haven_2.text: Whatever I expected to find lurking in this cursed gloom, it certainly wasn't this. A glimmer of hope amidst the darkness.

Shadowheart_Haven_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_Haven_0.text: That's one way of looking at it. You could also say it's a prime target - the one pocket of light in the gloom.

Shadowheart_Haven_1.speaker: Gale
Shadowheart_Haven_1.text: Pragmatism, thy name is Shadowheart. You're not wrong though - best we keep our sojourn here to a minimum.

Laezel_Philgraves_2.speaker: Gale
Laezel_Philgraves_2.text: There's magic here, but it's of a rancid, impure form. Nothing like the true Weave at all.

Laezel_Philgraves_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_Philgraves_0.text: This is why I appreciate a sharp blade to a ball of fire or a bolt of lightning. The Weave is inconsistent, unruly.

Laezel_Philgraves_1.speaker: Gale
Laezel_Philgraves_1.text: The Weave is constant, but its users? Anything but. We must be on our guard.
Laezel_Philgraves_1.context: NodeContext: Correcting her statement - 'guns don't kill people, people kill people' equivalent. Serious

Laezel_Philgraves_3.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_Philgraves_3.text: A githyanki warrior hardly needs to be told that.

Minthara_ROM_Act3_1.speaker: Gale
Minthara_ROM_Act3_1.text: I found an empty bottle of venom in camp, Minthara. Safe to assume it was yours?

Minthara_ROM_Act3_0.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Minthara_ROM_Act3_0.text: Indeed. I have been dosing my partner while they sleep by my side.

Minthara_ROM_Act3_2.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Minthara_ROM_Act3_2.text: They refuse to take it in their food, but I must build up their immunity in case we ever visit Menzoberranzan together.

Minthara_ROM_Act3_3.speaker: Gale
Minthara_ROM_Act3_3.text: Let's never speak of this again.
